Text:
The auditorium is an airy hall with three levels and,
at the moment, men in black are blocking every
exit.
The students are under constant surveillance.
So? What's the status?
Straight to the point as ever, Sir Gaunt.

We've pretty much got the Academy under lockdown.
The knights're makin' a fuss outside, but they can't
do anything.
None of that matters. Did you secure the artifact?
Oh yeah, the artifact, about that...

I think that little girl has it. The one with pink
hair.
So you did not secure it?
Well, no, guess not.
Do not make light of this.

Do you have any idea how much your idiocy has
hindered our plans?

No need to get so worked up. I got a good idea of
where to find it.
The next time you fail will be your last. Am I clear?

Yeah, yeah, I get it. I'll be back with the goods in
a flash.

Oh, that's right. We might have a bit of a
troublemaker in our midst.

They killed a buncha the Thirds and two of the
Seconds. Some guys had their hearts crushed,
and some had small holes through their vitals.

The latter was probably done with a rapier or the
like. And every one of 'em was killed with a single
blow. That takes a lotta skill.
I think it might be You-Know-Who.

Ah...the Shadow Garden? They finally took the
bait.
You'd better watch your back too.
You're really telling me to be careful...?

Well, I guess an ex-Rounds like yourself'll probably
be fine.

Hmph. Bring me the artifact and the heads of these
Shadow Garden gnats. Without fail.
No need to tell me twice.
Rex smirks and takes his leave.
After he leaves, Sir Gaunt chuckles.
At long last, all I desire shall be mine...

He removes an eerily-glowing artifact from his pocket,
regarding it with an unreadable gaze.
I shall make my glorious return to the Rounds.
The man continues to chuckle ominously.

As Rex walks with his henchmen through the corridor
of an academy building...

Their search for the artifact is cut short by a
bizarre phenomenon. The henchman walking
behind Rex abruptly vanishes without a trace.
Huh?
Rex looks around, unsure of what just happened.

But there is no sign of anything strange nearby. The
only lead he has to go on is that he'd heard the
sound of something whooshing through the air.
Then the man next to him vanishes just as abruptly.
...What the?
In moments, Rex is alone in the long corridor.
What the hell... Am I bein' attacked...?
Whoa!
Urgh...!
D-Dammit!!!
Rex finally understands what is happening.

Rex had seen enough combat to figure that much out.
The enemy was moving at speeds faster than the human
body was capable of producing.

That means they have the aid of some normally-
inconceivable power.

Bastard, so you got an auto-acceleration artifact
that lets ya move faster than I can see, do ya...
Rex speaks so that his attacker can hear.

His foe is difficult to see and impossible to hit, so
he is stuck taking a one-sided pummeling. From an
outside perspective, there is no worse predicament
than this.

But...he had clawed himself out of similar holes many
times in the past.
That's what made him Rex of the Named Children.
This calls for...a net!
You see what I just did? That's a net, bud!

No matter how fast you move, I'll know when you
touch it.

How many more times you think you can handle the
strain of that artifact, huh? Two, maybe three?

Moving at superhuman speeds always comes at a cost.
Rex didn't miss the signs of that.
Your uniform's covered with blood.

Rex had solved the puzzle when he saw the bloody
uniform.

His enemy is using an artifact to move at immense
speed. However, the price of that is taking a toll
on their body.

That is clear from how much they are bleeding.
They are probably nearing their limit. And if
Rex is still standing when they do... Victory is
his.

Being able to expose an opponent from just a
few scraps of information is what makes Rex
"The Game of Betrayal" of the Named
Children.
Bullseye.
(Victory is in sight.)

But...Rex isn't actually confident enough to say this.
On the contrary, it is on him to evade these
attacks two or three more times still.

That's precisely why he is putting on a strong front.
He can't let the enemy realize how uncertain he is.
This is a battle of...advanced psychological
warfare.
You're really overdoin' it...
D-Dammit!!!

I'm gettin' hit from inside the net...? But that's
frickin' impossible!

You little bastard, just what kinda artifact do you
have...
Wha...?
What the hell...
Countless corpses are seated inside the classroom.

All of them are black-clad men. It is easy to see
from their few external wounds that they were
each slain with a single strike.

(No way could just one guy take out this many
Children alone...)
What the...?!

Rex noticed an odd sweat in the palm of the hand that
held his sword.
(Does this guy not have any limits?)
You're the best.
That's what Rex hears the moment he dies.
